usageError.description: An error which represents a mis-use of an API and impedes correct functionality.

usageWarning.description: A warning about the usage of an API or configuration. The usage or configuration does not interfere with operation, but is not recommended or may result in unexpected behavior. Setting the timeout for identification too high.

0:3:0.description: This message indicates that a configuration option was not of the correct type. This primarily applies to languages that are not strongly typed.

message.parameterized: Config option "${name}" should be of type ${expectedType}, but received ${actualType}, using the default value (${defaultValue}).

parameters.actualType: The incorrect types used for the configuration option.
parameters.defaultValue: The default value of the configuration option.
parameters.expectedType: The correct type for the configuration option.
parameters.name: The name of the configuration option.

0:3:0.name: wrongType

0:3:1.description: This message indicates that an unrecognized configuration option was provided. This primarily applied to languages that are not strongly typed.

parameters.name: The option that was not recognized.

0:3:1.name: unknownOption
